articles.title: 'A line of fire': Argentina blaze burns 500,000 hectares amid drought
articles.description: BUENOS AIRES, Feb 14 (Reuters) - A devastating wildfire in the northern Argentine province of Corrientes has spread to cover more than 500,000 hectares, 6% of the region's total area, underscoring the impact of dry weather due to the Niña weather pattern in the South American nation.A Civil Defense source told Reuters that firefighters were working to bring the fire under

articles.description: Tottenham pair Cristian Romero and Giovani Lo Celso are among four Premier League players to have been hit with bans over the Covid chaos which saw last year’s clash between Argentina and Brazil abandoned.

articles.title: Fines, bans from FIFA: Brazil, Argentina told to play again
articles.description: LONDON (AP) — FIFA handed out fines and suspensions on Monday while ordering Brazil and Argentina to replay the World Cup qualifier that was abandoned after health officials stormed the field to question the quarantine status of players.
articles.content:

articles.title: Aston Villa duo Emi Martinez and Emi Buendia slapped with Argentina ban
articles.description: The pair were caught up in the controversy which surrounded the abandonment of Argentina's World Cup qualifier with Brazil back in September
articles.content:
Aston Villa duo Emi Martinez and Emi Buendia have been banned for two Argentina matches for "for not complying with the FIFA Return to Football International Match Protocol".

articles.title: Tennis-'Perfect start' for Ruud with title victory at Argentina Open
articles.description: Norway's Casper Ruud said he made the "perfect start" to the 2022 season after winning his seventh ATP tour title at the Argentina Open in Buenos Aires on Sunday.
articles.content: Norway's Casper Ruud said he made the "perfect start" to the 2022 season after winning his seventh ATP tour title at the Argentina Open in Buenos Aires on Sunday. Ruud bounced back from a shaky start to defeat local favorite Diego Schwartzman 5-7 6-2... [1038 chars]
